details.title: Two ways of denaturation leading to different transition states of fibrinogen
details.abstract: HFG (hurran fibrinogen) desorbed from a PTFE (polytetrafluoroethylene) surface and thermally denatured HFG were conforrrationally studied by using FTIR (Fourier transform infrared) spectroscopy. It is shown that some irreversible conformational changes of HFG, including a decrease in theβstructure content, were induced by the PTFE surface adsorption/desorption. This suggests that some α-helix structures should transform into β-structures. Oesorbed HFG was thermally denatured as well as the native HFG under a thermal incubation of 30 min at 73 After the sarre thermal treatrrent, theαx00AB;-helix content in the therrrally denatured desorbed HFG was obviously less than that in the former native HFG.
